etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Pinipicrin from classical Latin pīnus + German -i- + ancient Greek πικρός bitter + German -in

definitions: A bitter glucoside, C₂₂ H₃₆ O₁₁, obtained from the needles and bark of the Scots pine, Pinus sylvestris, and the leaves of the American arbor vitae, Thuja occidentalis.
